Post.title: docker-composelnmp
Post._content:
Dockerdockerlnmp

<!-- more -->

lnmpphp, nginx, redis, mysqldockerCompose `ComposeDockerDockerComposedocker-compose.yaml`

#### docker-compose.yaml
```
version: '3'
services: 
    nginx:
        build: ./nginx 
        ports:
            - "80:80"
        volumes:
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/project:/etc/nginx/project"
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/lualib:/etc/nginx/lualib" 
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/nginx.conf"
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/logs:/etc/nginx/logs"
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/vhosts:/etc/nginx/vhosts"
            - "./nginx/volume-nginx/ssl:/etc/nginx/ssl"
            - "~/wwwroot:/Users/Johnny/wwwroot"
        networks:
            - webnet

    php:
        build: ./php 
        ports:
            - "9000:9000"
        volumes:
            - "~/wwwroot:/Users/Johnny/wwwroot"
            - "./php/php-fpm.d:/usr/local/etc/php-fpm.d"
            - "./php/logs:/usr/local/etc/logs"
        networks:
            - webnet

    etcd-browser:
        build: ./etcd-browser 
        ports:
            - "8000:8000"
        environment:
            ETCD_HOST: 10.10.134.33
            ETCD_PORT: 2379
        networks:
            - webnet

    mysql:
        build: ./mysql 
        ports:
            - "3306:3306"
        volumes:
            - "./mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql"
        environment:
            MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: 123456
        networks:
            - webnet

    adminer:
        image: adminer
        restart: always
        ports:
            - 8080:8080

    redis:
        build: ./redis 
        ports:
            - "6379:6379"
        networks:
            - webnet

    memcached:
        build: ./memcached
        ports:
            - "11211:11211"
        networks:
            - webnet

networks:
    webnet:
```
###### docker-compose.yaml 
docker-compose.yamldockerdocker-composelnmp
```
version: '3'
services: 
    mysql:
        build: ./mysql 
        ports:
            - "3306:3306"
        volumes:
            - "./mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql"
        environment:
            MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: 123456
        networks:
            - webnet
```
- version: 3  yaml312dockerAPIYamldocker
- services:  
- mysql:  
- build: ./mysql docker-compose.yaml, build
```
 mysql:
    build:
      context: ./mysql  //
      dockerfile: Dockerfile-alternate   //DockerfilecontextDockerfile
      args:  //
        buildno: 1
```
- ports:  //80->80
  - 80:80
  - 9000:9000
- volumes:  //./mysql-datadocker/var/lib/mysql
- networks: //, :  
    webnet:
```
- networks: 
    webnet:
      aliases:
       - databases
	legacy:
      aliases:
       - mysql
```
- environment:  //
   MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: 123456
-

```

    README.md

    frontend
    server.js

    client-cert.pem

    ib_logfile0
    ib_logfile1
    ibdata1
    ibtmp1
    mysql
    performance_schema
    private_key.pem
    public_key.pem
    server-cert.pem
    server-key.pem
    sys
    test
    xfile
 nginx
    Dockerfile
    start.sh
    volume-nginx
 php
    Dockerfile
    logs
    php-fpm.d
 redis

```
#### docker-compose 

```
 docker-compose ps
        Name                       Command               State            Ports
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
docker_adminer_1        entrypoint.sh docker-php-e ...   Up      0.0.0.0:8080->8080/tcp
docker_etcd-browser_1   nodejs server.js                 Up      0.0.0.0:8000->8000/tcp
docker_memcached_1      docker-entrypoint.sh memcached   Up      0.0.0.0:11211->11211/tcp
docker_mysql_1          docker-entrypoint.sh mysqld      Up      0.0.0.0:3306->3306/tcp
docker_nginx_1          nginx -g daemon off;             Up      0.0.0.0:80->80/tcp
docker_php_1            docker-php-entrypoint php-fpm    Up      0.0.0.0:9000->9000/tcp
docker_redis_1          docker-entrypoint.sh redis ...   Up      0.0.0.0:6379->6379/tcp
```

```
 docker-compose restart nginx
Restarting docker_nginx_1 ... done
```
, builddocker-compose.ymldocker-compose.yaml-fdocker-compose

```
Building nginx
Step 1/1 : FROM nginx:latest

```

```

```

Post.title: golanggoroutine
Post.raw:
---
title: golanggoroutine
date: 2019-02-02
tags:
  - Go 
  - golang
categories:
  - 
---
golanggoroutinegotoutinegoroutine
<!-- more -->

##### goroutinegoroutine
goroutine, 
```
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "time"
)

var (
    control, close = make(chan int, 1), make(chan int, 1)
    config         = map[string]string{
        "a": "a",
    }
)

func main() {
    fmt.Println("start...")
    dosomething(config)
    <-close
}

func dosomething(config map[string]string) {
    go gorou(config)
}

func gorou(config map[string]string) {
    fmt.Println("config...", config)
    i := 0
    for {
        select {
        case <-control:
            fmt.Println("restart...")
            return
        default:
            time.Sleep(1 * time.Second)
            i++
            fmt.Println(i)
            if i >= 3 {
                control <- 1
                //update config or do other things
                args := map[string]string{
                    "restart": "restart...map",
                    "time":    time.Now().String(),
                }
                dosomething(args)
            }
        }
    }
}
```

##### 
control`control = make(chan int)`, control<-1
```
start...
config... map[a:a]
1
2
3
fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock!

goroutine 1 [chan receive]:
main.main()
        /Users/Johnny/go/src/github.com/JohnnyWei188/learn/goroutine_exit3.go:18 +0x94

goroutine 5 [chan send]:
main.gorou(0xc420072180)
        /Users/Johnny/go/src/github.com/JohnnyWei188/learn/goroutine_exit3.go:38 +0x18d
created by main.dosomething
        /Users/Johnny/go/src/github.com/JohnnyWei188/learn/goroutine_exit3.go:22 +0x3f
exit status 2
```
controlchancapacitycontrolchanneli=3channe 

`control=make(chan int, 1)``control<-1`channelbufferdosomethinggoroutinegoroutine

```
//    "restart": "restart...map",
//    "time":    time.Now().String(),
//}
//dosomething(args)
```

```
start...
config... map[a:a]
1
2
3
restart...
fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock!

goroutine 1 [chan receive]:
main.main()
        /Users/Johnny/go/src/github.com/JohnnyWei188/learn/goroutine_exit3.go:18 +0x94
exit status 2
```

Post.title: go pprof
Post._content:
go,watchkubernetesserviceservicepodspodMySQLCPUpprof
<!--more-->

,CPUstracewait.
{% asset_img cpu.png cpu profile %}
Go pprof

go
- CPU profile,  CPU  CPU 
- Memory ProfileHeap Profile
- Block Profiling goroutines 
- Goroutine Profiling goroutines  goroutine 

#### pprof
pprofgo2`net/http/pprof``runtime/pprof`
:
- `net/http/pprof`httpserver
- `runtime/pprof`

`net/http/pprof``runtime/pprof`

#### pprof

```
import _ "net/http/pprof"
```
main
```
go func() {
    log.Println(http.ListenAndServe("localhost:6060", nil))
}()
```
`http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof`:
```
/debug/pprof/

profiles:
0    block
31   goroutine
53   heap
0    mutex
10   threadcreate

full goroutine stack dump
```

- /debug/pprof/profile CPU profiling 30s
- /debug/pprof/heap Memory Profiling  Profiling 
- /debug/pprof/blockblock Profiling 
- /debug/pprof/goroutines goroutines 

#### pprof

```
import "runtime/pprof"
```
main
```
var cpuprofile = flag.String("cpuprofile", "", "write cpu profile to `file`")
var memprofile = flag.String("memprofile", "", "write memory profile to `file`")

func main() {
    flag.Parse()
    if *cpuprofile != "" {
        f, err := os.Create(*cpuprofile)
        if err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not create CPU profile: ", err)
        }
        if err := pprof.StartCPUProfile(f); err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not start CPU profile: ", err)
        }
        defer pprof.StopCPUProfile()
    }

    // ... rest of the program ...

    if *memprofile != "" {
        f, err := os.Create(*memprofile)
        if err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not create memory profile: ", err)
        }
        runtime.GC() // get up-to-date statistics
        if err := pprof.WriteHeapProfile(f); err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not write memory profile: ", err)
        }
        f.Close()
    }
}
```
runtimepprofCPU

#### go tool pprof
go pprof tool

###### 
```
go tool pprof http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/profile
```

```
go tool pprof http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/profile
```

```
    8000ms 16.56% 33.73%     8000ms 16.56%  runtime.mach_semaphore_wait /usr/local/Cellar/go/1.9.2/libexec/src/runtime/sys_darwin_amd64.s
    7860ms 16.27% 50.00%     7860ms 16.27%  runtime.mach_semaphore_timedwait /usr/local/Cellar/go/1.9.2/libexec/src/runtime/sys_darwin_amd64.s
    7850ms 16.25% 66.25%     7850ms 16.25%  runtime.kevent /usr/local/Cellar/go/1.9.2/libexec/src/runtime/sys_darwin_amd64.s
    2850ms  5.90% 72.14%     4970ms 10.29%  runtime.scanobject /usr/local/Cellar/go/1.9.2/libexec/src/runtime/mgcmark.go
```

```
import _ "net/http/pprof"
```
main
```
go func() {
    log.Println(http.ListenAndServe("localhost:6060", nil))
}()
```
`http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof`:
```
/debug/pprof/

profiles:
0    block
31   goroutine
53   heap
0    mutex
10   threadcreate

full goroutine stack dump
```

- /debug/pprof/profile CPU profiling 30s
- /debug/pprof/heap Memory Profiling  Profiling 
- /debug/pprof/blockblock Profiling 
- /debug/pprof/goroutines goroutines 

#### pprof

```
import "runtime/pprof"
```
main
```
var cpuprofile = flag.String("cpuprofile", "", "write cpu profile to `file`")
var memprofile = flag.String("memprofile", "", "write memory profile to `file`")

func main() {
    flag.Parse()
    if *cpuprofile != "" {
        f, err := os.Create(*cpuprofile)
        if err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not create CPU profile: ", err)
        }
        if err := pprof.StartCPUProfile(f); err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not start CPU profile: ", err)
        }
        defer pprof.StopCPUProfile()
    }

    // ... rest of the program ...

    if *memprofile != "" {
        f, err := os.Create(*memprofile)
        if err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not create memory profile: ", err)
        }
        runtime.GC() // get up-to-date statistics
        if err := pprof.WriteHeapProfile(f); err != nil {
            log.Fatal("could not write memory profile: ", err)
        }
        f.Close()
    }
}
```

Post.title: nginx
Post.raw:
---
title: nginx 
date: 2019-01-15
tags:
  - nginx 
categories:
  - 
---

##### CROS 
CROS, (Cross-origin resource sharing)
<!--more-->

#### nginx
```
add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' 'http://demo.csrf.com';
add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Methods' 'GET,POST,OPTIONS';
add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers' 'DNT,X-Mx-ReqToken,Keep-Alive,User-Agent,X-Requested-With,If-Modified-Since,Cache-Control,Content-Type,Authorization';
add_header 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' 'X-Custom-Header';

if ($request_method = 'OPTIONS') {
    return 204;
}
```

#### 
- Access-Control-Allow-Origin, demo.csrf.comhttp
- X-Custom-HeadernginxAccess-Control-Expose-Headers
- MethodsOPTIONS 2: 
- - : 21) HEADGETPOST 2) http header: AcceptAccept-languageContent-LanguageLast-Event-IDContent-Type3application/x-www-form-urlencodedmultipart/form-datatext/plain
- - : , httpContent-Type json/applicationOPTIONShttp method, OPTIONSAccess-Control-Expose-HeadersAccess-Control-Allow-OriginPOST

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Post.title: hexotravisgithubcoding
Post._content:
hexogithubBlogtravis-cigithubhexotravis-ci
<!--more-->

### hexo
githubtravisgithubcoding

### githubCI
 [travis-ci](https://travis-ci.org)githubtravis-cigithubtravisCI

### Travis
Travis CI Command Line Client

### Travis
travis CItravisgithub

```
xxxdeMacBook-Pro:~ Johnny$ travis login 

We need your GitHub login to identify you.
This information will not be sent to Travis CI, only to api.github.com.
The password will not be displayed.

Try running with --github-token or --auto if you don't want to enter your password anyway.

Username: xxx@gmail.com
Password for xxx@gmail.com: **********
Successfully logged in as xxx!
```



```
xxxdeMacBook-Pro:~ Johnny$ travis whoami
Outdated CLI version, run `gem install travis`.
You are JohnnyWei188
```

### 
Travis

```
xxxdeMacBook-Pro:.travis Johnny$ travis encrypt-file id_rsa 
Outdated CLI version, run `gem install travis`.
Detected repository as xxx/xxx.github.io, is this correct? |yes| yes
encrypting id_rsa for xxx/xxx.github.io
storing result as id_rsa.enc
storing secure env variables for decryption

Please add the following to your build script (before_install stage in your .travis.yml, for instance):

    openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_key -iv $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv -in id_rsa.enc -out id_rsa -d

Pro Tip: You can add it automatically by running with --add.

Make sure to add id_rsa.enc to the git repository.
Make sure not to add id_rsa to the git repository.
Commit all changes to your .travis.yml.

```
hexo.travisgithubcoding

### .travis.yml 
openssl2`$encrypted_ffdfc123d95c``encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv`2travis-ciCIcopyopenssl.travis.ymlbefore_scriptstage

```
before_script:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_key -iv $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv -in .travis/id_rsa.enc -out ~/.ssh/id_rsa -d
  - chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  - eval $(ssh-agent)
  - ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  - cp .travis/ssh_config ~/.ssh/config
  - git config --global user.name 'xxx'
  - git config --global user.email xxx@gmail.com
```
### hexo
_config.ymldeploystagegithupcodinggit

```
deploy:
  type: git
  name: xxx
  email: xxx@gmail.com
  repo: 
    github: git@github.com:xxx/xxx.github.io.git,master
    coding: git@git.coding.net:xxx/xxx.git,master

```

### 
Travis-CIhexo d -g githubcoding



* github
* Travis-CIgithub
* githubcoding

Travis-CIgithubCIdocker_config.ymlgithubcoding

###

```
Outdated CLI version, run `gem install travis`.
Detected repository as xxx/xxx.github.io, is this correct? |yes| yes
encrypting id_rsa for xxx/xxx.github.io
storing result as id_rsa.enc
storing secure env variables for decryption

Please add the following to your build script (before_install stage in your .travis.yml, for instance):

    openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_key -iv $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv -in id_rsa.enc -out id_rsa -d

Pro Tip: You can add it automatically by running with --add.

Make sure to add id_rsa.enc to the git repository.
Make sure not to add id_rsa to the git repository.
Commit all changes to your .travis.yml.

```
hexo.travisgithubcoding

### .travis.yml 
openssl2`$encrypted_ffdfc123d95c``encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv`2travis-ciCIcopyopenssl.travis.ymlbefore_scriptstage

```
before_script:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_key -iv $encrypted_ffdfc123d95c_iv -in .travis/id_rsa.enc -out ~/.ssh/id_rsa -d
  - chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  - eval $(ssh-agent)
  - ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  - cp .travis/ssh_config ~/.ssh/config
  - git config --global user.name 'xxx'
  - git config --global user.email xxx@gmail.com
```
### hexo
_config.ymldeploystagegithupcodinggit

```
deploy:
  type: git
  name: xxx
  email: xxx@gmail.com
  repo: 
    github: git@github.com:xxx/xxx.github.io.git,master
    coding: git@git.coding.net:xxx/xxx.git,master

```

##### 
openssl, , SSL
<!--more-->

##### openssl
https httpTCP/IPSSL/TLS SSL()TLS()TLSSSLTLSSSLv31999IETFTLSv1.0SSLv3.1
openssl openssl3SSLSSLTLSnginx, apache

##### openssl?
opensslopenssl
#####  
```
openssl enc 
  -e  -des3  des3
  -d  -des3  des3
  -a  base64
  -salt 
  -out  
  -in   

openssl enc -e -des3 -a -salt -in johnny -out johnny.jiami
```

##### 

- 
```
openssl genrsa [-out filename] [-passout arg] [-des] [-des3] [-idea] [-f4] [-3] [-rand file(s)] [-engine id] [numbits]

4096
openssl genrsa -out johnny.key 4096  

```

```
-out filename 
-des -des3 -idea 
numbits 2048
```
- 
```
openssl rsa [-inform PEM|NET|DER] [-outform PEM|NET|DER] [-in filename] [-passin arg] [-out filename] [-passout arg] [-sgckey] [-des] [-des3][-idea] [-text] [-noout] [-modulus] [-check] [-pubin] [-pubout] [-engine id]


openssl rsa -in johnny.key -out johnny.pub -pubout
```

```
-in 
-out 
- pubout 
```

##### 
```
openssl dgst -md5 johnny.key


-md5
-md4
-sha1
-sha
-dss1
```

##### 
```
openssl rand - num
openssl rand -base64 10

-base64 base64
-hex 16
-out 
numbytes
```

##### 
```
openssl passwd 
() echo -n "123456" | openssl passwd -crypt stdin
() openssl passwd -1 -in johnny.mingwen

-1 md5
-crypt Linux
-in 
stdin 
```
